article_content:
**House Passes 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act'**

The House of Representatives passed the "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" (H.R. 1), a sweeping legislation that reduces taxes, modifies spending for various federal programs, increases the statutory debt limit, and addresses agencies and programs across the government. The bill was signed into law on July 4, 2025, becoming Public Law No. 119-21.

The House Budget Committee is responsible for overseeing this legislation. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00) The bill was sponsored by Rep. Jodey C. Arrington, who can be found on the House website at [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375).

While the bill has been passed by the House, it currently lacks cosponsors. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)  The bill's 20 proposed amendments are not publicly available on the House Budget Committee website.

No hearings have been scheduled for the bill as of yet. [Congress.gov](https://www.congress.gov/) does not provide data on hearings for bills. The Senate also voted on the bill, passing it by a party-line vote of 51 to 50. [Record Vote Number: 372](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3059/votes)

**Senate Approves Motion to Proceed on Continuing Appropriations Bill**

The Senate voted 54-45 along party lines to advance the Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act of 2026. The bill, which provides continuing funding for federal agencies in fiscal year 2026, also extends various extensions and includes additional security funding for federal officials.  The legislation is currently under consideration by the Senate.

The House Appropriations Committee and House Budget Committee are responsible for the bill. Rep. Tom Cole of Oklahoma is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053) 

The bill has no cosponsors, but the Appropriations Committee and Budget Committee are listed as the top five cosponsors. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00) 

No hearings have been scheduled for the bill, and no amendments have been proposed. The Senate vote on the motion to proceed was a party-line vote with 54 senators voting in favor and 45 voting against. [Record Vote Number: 590](https://www.congress.gov/vote/?id=590)

# House Passes Pay Our Troops Act of 2026

The House Appropriations Committee has referred HR.5401, the Pay Our Troops Act of 2026, to further consideration. The bill provides continuing appropriations for military pay during periods when interim or full-year appropriations are not in effect, such as during a government shutdown. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401)

The bill was introduced by Rep. Kiggans, Jennifer A., and cosponsored by 20 members of Congress.  Rep. Fitzpatrick, Rep. Mace, and Rep. Kean are among the top 5 cosponsors. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194) [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-crenshaw-dan/C001120](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-crenshaw-dan/C001120) 

The bill is currently under review by the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)  No hearings have been scheduled for the bill, according to congressional records. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)

bill_title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026
article_content:
**Senate Passes National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026**

The Senate passed the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026 on October 9, 2025, with a vote of 77-20. The bill outlines policies and authorities for the Department of Defense (DOD) programs and activities, military construction, and national defense. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296)

The bill now moves to the House Armed Services Committee for further consideration. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00) 

Sen. Roger F. Wicker (R-MS), the sponsor of the bill, can be found on [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437).  The bill has no cosponsors at this time. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00) 

No hearings have been scheduled for the bill as of yet.  [Find more information about the bill](https://www.congress.gov/). The bill has 20 proposed amendments. [Link to the bill] A bipartisan vote of 77 to 20 was recorded in the Senate on October 9, 2025. [Record Vote Number: 570](https://www.congress.gov/vote/?id=570)

bill_title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho, as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office".
article_content:
# Senate Bill S.24 Aims to Rename Post Office After Maxine Bell

A new bill, S.24, has been introduced in the U.S. Senate to rename the United States Postal Service facility located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office". The bill is currently under consideration by the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.  The bill's sponsor is Senator Mike Crapo. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24)

Senator Crapo has been joined by Senator James E. Risch as a cosponsor of the bill.  Both Senators are members of the Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880) [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00) 

The bill has not yet been scheduled for a hearing, and no amendments have been proposed.  [Find more information about congressional hearings](https://www.congress.gov/about).

bill_title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026
article_content:
**Senate Passes Continuing Appropriations Bill with Expanded Health Insurance Credit Extension**

The Senate has passed the Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026, which provides continuing funding for federal agencies and permanently extends the expanded premium tax credit for health insurance purchases. The bill is currently awaiting consideration by the House of Representatives. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882)

The bill was sponsored by Senator Patty Murray (D-WA). [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111)  The bill has no cosponsors. 

No hearings have been scheduled for the bill, and no amendments have been proposed. The Senate voted against invoking a third cloture motion and a second cloture motion on the bill. [Link to Record Vote Number: 557](https://www.congress.gov/vote/557)  [Link to Record Vote Number: 550](https://www.congress.gov/vote/550)

# Senate Passes Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025

The Senate has passed S.499, the Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025. The bill aims to prevent a government shutdown by providing continuing appropriations if an appropriations bill for the fiscal year hasn't been enacted before the start of the fiscal year.  The bill is currently in the House Appropriations Committee [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/499](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/499). 

Sen. Paul, Rand (R-KY) is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603)  The bill has no cosponsors. The top 5 cosponsors are not listed on the House Appropriations Committee website [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00).  No hearings have been held on the bill, and no amendments have been proposed. No votes have been taken on the bill. [link to search results]

bill_title: An executive resolution authorizing the en bloc consideration in Executive Session of certain nominations on the Executive Calendar.
article_content:
**Senate Passes Resolution Authorizing En Bloc Consideration of Certain Nominations**

The Senate unanimously agreed to a resolution on October 3, 2025, that would allow for expedited consideration of certain nominations during executive sessions. The resolution, SRES.412, passed with a vote of 51-46. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412)

The resolution was sponsored by Senator John Thune, who can be found on the Senate website at [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250).  The bill has no cosponsors. 

No hearings have been scheduled for the bill, and two amendments have been proposed. The specific content of these amendments is unknown. [Link to source]
